1.text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened to ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

2.text: And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

3.text: They that were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

4.text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

5.text: While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

6.text: And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.

7.text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

8.text: And the foolish said to the wise, Give us of your oil: for our lamps are gone out.

9.text: But the wise answered, saying, Not so; lest there be not enough for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.

10.text: And while they were going to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready, went in with him to the marriage, and the door was shut.

11.text: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.

12.text: But he answered and said, Verily I say to you, I know you not.

13.text: Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour in which the Son of man cometh.

14.text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man traveling into a far country, who called his own servants, and delivered to them his goods.

15.text: And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and forthwith took his journey.

16.text: Then he that had received the five talents, went and traded with the same, and gained other five talents.

17.text: And likewise he that had received two, he also gained other two.

18.text: But he that had received one, went and digged in the earth, and hid his lordâ€™s money.

19.text: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them.

20.text: And he that had received five talents, came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst to me five talents: behold, I have gained besides them five talents more.

21.text: His lord said to him, Well done thou good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

22.text: He also that had received two talents came, and said, Lord, thou deliveredst to me two talents: behold, I have gained two other talents besides them.

23.text: His lord said to him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

24.text: Then he who had received the one talent came, and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strewed:

25.text: And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, there thou hast what is thine.

26.text: His lord answered and said to him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not strewed:

27.text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, and then at my coming I should have received my own with interest.

28.text: Take therefore the talent from him, and give it to him who hath ten talents.

29.text: For to every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath.

30.text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into utter darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

31.text: When the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then will he sit upon the throne of his glory:

32.text: And before him shall be gathered all nations: and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats:

33.text: And he will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

34.text: Then will the King say to them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:

35.text: For I was hungry, and ye gave me food: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:

36.text: Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came to me.

37.text: Then will the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungry, and fed thee? or thirsty, and gave thee drink?

38.text: When saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee?

39.text: Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came to thee?

40.text: And the king will answer and say to them, Verily I say to you, Inasmuch as ye have done it to one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it to me.

41.text: Then will he say also to them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

42.text: For I was hungry, and ye gave me no food: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:

43.text: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

44.text: Then will they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister to thee?

45.text: Then will he answer them, saying, Verily I say to you, Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me.

46.text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.
